descript.abstract: The County of Monterey Assessor's Parcel Layer is intended to be used to locate and identify taxable property within Monterey County as of 2006. A combination of original source data were used to create the dataset. Source data may include, but is not limited to: assessor maps, parcel maps, survey maps, cities and towns maps, property deeds, County of Monterey Megabyte database, satellite imagery, aerial imagery, and recorded documents. Data has been updated by comparing those parcel numbers listed in the Megabyte database to those that exist in the GIS layer and generating difference reports. Parcels were then researched and updated accordingly. The County of Monterey does not garauntee the accuracy of this data, and assumes no liability for the use of this data.
descript.purpose: For use with GIS software. This layer intended to show the location, boundary, size, and dimensions of parcels in relation to their surroundings.

idinfo.useconst: This layer is intended for assessment purposes only. The data presented here is a graphical representation of the features depicted and is not a legal document. Lot line adjustments are a part of daily maintenance, for this reason reference to the original assessor's source maps referenced by book and page are imperative. Monterey County GIS data shall not be edited without being acknowledged as such. Monterey County GIS data shall not be redistributed. Monterey County shall be the sole source for this data. Data are licensed to Princeton University-affiliated persons only.

cntorgp.cntorg: Map and Geospatial Information Center, Lewis Library, Princeton University

cntaddr.address: Map and Geospatial Information Center, Lewis Library, Princeton University

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.0 (Build 6001) Service Pack 1; Esri ArcGIS 10.2.0.3348

attracc.attraccr: County Tax Maps registered using Root Mean Square (RMS) method. RMS error not to exceed 4 feet for a 1:100 scale map.

dataqual.complete: Parcels last updated May 2005. Prior to that they were updated Nov-Dec 2004. Parcels that may have been updated after Dec. 2004 may be missing all attributes except APN. For more information contact Monterey County Assessor's office.

procstep.procdesc: When updating parcel geometry, the county Book and Page maps were registered to existing data. Polygon geometry updated to comply with topology rules. Attribution will be updated by merging the SDE Parcel Layer with Megabyte DB using APN as a primary key.
